alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:34AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is creating snow melt, with some areas in the southern basin seeing most of the snowpack melted. High temperatures on Wednesday will range from the low 50s, to the upper 60s in forested areas. This is expected to further ripen the snow pack where it still exists and, with anticipated melting, will cause increased flows of water into the rivers. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. This will impact rate of rise in many locations, with some rivers responding quickly and other forecast points seeing a delay in rising levels. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later over the next few days, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...From Saturday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. City begins to mobilize. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 0.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday evening and continue rising to 12.3 feet Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
